headline: Top Stock Reports for Micron Technology, Goldman Sachs & Verizon
summary: Micron Technology rides AI-driven memory demand and DRAM recovery, as Goldman Sachs sharpens its IB focus and Verizon accelerates 5G and broadband expansion.

headline: Hilton’s Record 2025 Growth Tests Balance Between Expansion And Payouts
summary: Hilton Worldwide Holdings (NYSE:HLT) reported a record year in 2025. The company added nearly 100,000 new rooms and surpassed 9,000 hotels globally. Hilton reached its 1,000th luxury and lifestyle hotel and launched new brands. The group significantly expanded its development pipeline during 2025. Hilton, one of the largest global hotel operators, is leaning into scale across its full range of brands, from limited service to luxury. For investors, the 2025 figures indicate meaningful...

headline: Billionaire Investor Bill Ackman Exits Chipotle Completely, Buys Meta Stock Instead
summary: Bill Ackman’s Pershing Square Capital made a significant portfolio shift, selling its entire stake in Chipotle Mexican Grill (NYSE:CMG) and taking a new position in Meta Platforms (NASDAQ:META), marking a rotation from consumer discretionary into AI infrastructure. The Trade That Turned Heads Ackman’s firm exited Chipotle along with positions in Nike (NYSE:NKE) and Hilton (NYSE:HLT), ... headline: What Hilton Worldwide Holdings (HLT)'s Earnings Beat, Dividend Hike and Cautious 2026 Guidance Mean For Shareholders
summary: Hilton Worldwide Holdings Inc. recently reported fourth-quarter 2025 results that exceeded earnings and revenue expectations, while also authorizing a regular US$0.15 per-share quarterly dividend payable on March 31, 2026 and continuing sizable share repurchases under its long-running buyback program. The company paired record adjusted EBITDA of US$3.70 billion and rapid global room growth with 2026 earnings guidance that fell short of analyst forecasts, highlighting a tension between strong...

headline: AI Disruption Trade Drives Divide in Travel and Leisure Stocks
summary: The price action has been stark: TripAdvisor Inc. has plunged 29% this year, sinking to an all-time low this week after its earnings disappointed.  Booking Holdings Inc. and Amadeus IT Group SA have each lost 22% this year.  By contrast, Marriott International Inc. has surged 14% and Hilton Worldwide Holdings Inc. has gained 12%, with analysts raising price targets on Hilton following its Feb. 11 earnings report, according to data compiled by Bloomberg.

headline: China Is Snapping Up Overseas Assets Again From Puma to Metals
summary: In January alone, the volume of outbound mergers and acquisitions from Greater China approached $12 billion, the most for the first month of a year since 2017.  The turnaround is gathering momentum after a prolonged lull that began in the mid to late 2010s, when China capped outbound investment to rein in exuberant spending.  One particularly high-profile case was HNA Group Co., which went on a debt-fueled international binge into names such as Hilton Worldwide Holdings Inc. and Deutsche Bank AG before collapsing.
